title: Ecosystems and Food Webs

vocab.definition: All the living and nonliving things in an environment and how they interact
A diagram showing how energy flows through multiple food chains in an ecosystem
An organism that makes its own food, usually through photosynthesis
An organism that breaks down dead plants and animals

teachingNotes: Use diagrams to show energy flow. Discuss human impact on ecosystems. Connect to local environments students know.

sample.question: What would happen to an ecosystem if all the producers disappeared?
expectedAny: consumers would have no food source

truefalse.question: Energy in a food web always flows from producers to consumers to decomposers.
expectedAny: decomposers break down all organism levels

multiplechoice.question: In a forest ecosystem, which organism is a primary consumer?

fillintheblank.question: The _____ level of a food web contains organisms that make their own food.

shortanswer.question: Explain why food webs are more realistic than simple food chains.
